title: City of Roanoke Rescue of Black-and-White Tuxedo Cat (Valiente)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

February 21, 2026

 FOIA Officer for the City of Roanoke, Virginia
robin.viohl@roanokeva.gov

Re: FOIA Request – October 27, 2024 Rescue of Black-and-White Tuxedo Cat (Valiente)

Dear FOIA Officer:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I request records related to the rescue, handling, and custody of a black-and-white tuxedo cat named Valiente at Towers Shopping Center, Roanoke, Virginia, on October 27, 2024. This request includes records in the custody of both the Roanoke Police Department (including Animal Control) and Roanoke Fire-EMS.
Please provide all records, electronic or paper, in the following categories:

1. Personnel Information
Names, badge numbers, and assignments of any Police officers present at the scene.
Any Animal Control officers notified, dispatched, or involved.
Names and assignments of Fire-EMS personnel, including Battalion Chief Robert Perdue and the responding firehouses.

2. Incident and Dispatch Records
CAD reports, dispatch logs, event summaries, and call detail records related to the incident.
Incident reports, after-action reports, or any internal reports generated by Police or Fire-EMS in connection with this event.

3. Body-Worn Camera / Audio / Video
All Police body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage, and radio communications/audio logs related to the rescue.
Any Fire-EMS audio, video, or operational recordings capturing the rescue or related communications.

4. Animal Handling / Custody Records
Intake logs, custody forms, or reports for Valiente on or about October 27, 2024.
Records showing which personnel or units had custody or transported the cat after the rescue.
Any documentation showing transfer to RCACP, veterinary providers, or other entities, including timing and personnel involved.
Records reflecting release, adoption, euthanasia, or continued custody of the cat.

5. Communications
Emails, memoranda, or written communications referencing Valiente.
Communications between Police, Fire-EMS, RCACP, or veterinary providers regarding the rescue, custody, or evaluation of the cat.

6. Metadata / Additional Notes
If records exist electronically, please provide metadata showing creation, modification, or access, to the extent easily available.
Please first confirm which records exist and provide an estimate of any fees before producing records, so that I may consider narrowing the request if necessary.
If separate fees apply for Police or Fire-EMS records, please notify me prior to processing.
If portions of records are exempt from disclosure, please identify the statutory exemption and provide all reasonably segregable portions.

Please note that during the incident, I may have used a different phone number than my current one; records associated with that number are responsive to this request.

Thank you for your assistance in fulfilling this request.

Respectfully, 

/s/ Charles Stanley DeLozier Jr.

Charles Stanley DeLozier Jr., pro se
1328 Peachtree Street NE
Atlanta, Georgia 30309-3209
(404) 389-5642
csdelozier@pm.me

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Stanley DeLozier Jr.

title: FOIA Request – October 27, 2024 Rescue of Black-and-White Tuxedo Cat (Valiente)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

February 21, 2026

FOIA Officer Regional Center for Animal Care & Protection (RCACP)
Melinda Rector
mrector@roanokecountyva.gov

Re: FOIA Request – Custody, Care, and Handling of Black-and-White Tuxedo Cat (Valiente), October 27, 2024

Dear FOIA Officer:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I request records related to the custody, handling, and care of a black-and-white tuxedo cat named Valiente, rescued on October 27, 2024 at Towers Shopping Center, Roanoke, Virginia. This request is limited to records held by RCACP.

Please provide all records, electronic or paper, in the following categories:

1. Personnel / Custody Information
Names and positions of RCACP staff who handled, evaluated, or had custody of Valiente after the rescue.
Records identifying any staff who received, transferred, or otherwise maintained custody of the cat.

2. Intake / Care / Transfer Records
Intake logs, stray reports, kennel or holding records, and any custody forms for Valiente on or about October 27–30, 2024.
Records reflecting transfer to RCACP from Police, Fire-EMS, or other entities.
Records of veterinary care, evaluation, or treatment performed while the cat was in RCACP custody.
Records reflecting release, adoption, euthanasia, or continued custody.

3. Communications
Emails, memoranda, or other written communications referencing Valiente.
Communications between RCACP and Police, Fire-EMS, veterinary providers, or other entities regarding the cat.

4. Metadata / Additional Notes
If records exist electronically, please provide metadata showing creation, modification, or access, to the extent easily available.
Please first confirm which records exist and provide an estimate of any fees before producing records, so that I may consider narrowing the request if necessary.
If portions of records are exempt from disclosure, please identify the statutory exemption and provide all reasonably segregable portions.

Please note that communications with me around the October 27, 2024 incident may have used a different phone number than the one listed above; records associated with that number are responsive.

Thank you for your assistance in fulfilling this request.
Sincerely,

/s/ Charles Stanley DeLozier Jr. 

Charles Stanley DeLozier Jr., pro se
1328 Peachtree Street NE
Atlanta, Georgia 30309-3209
(404) 389-5642
csdelozier@pm.me

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Stanley DeLozier Jr.
